alert.note: Alert for Erie (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 12 at 3:47PM EDT until August 12 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR ERIE COUNTY... At 347 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated another round of thunderstorms producing heavy rain moving into the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.8 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Sandusky, Western Vermilion, Vermilion, Northern Milan, Castalia, Berlin Heights, Bay View, Fairview Lanes, Sandusky South and Bloomingville. This includes the following streams and drainages... Erie, Lake, Cranberry Creek, Mud Brook, Darby Creek, Seymour Creek, Huron River, Vermilion River, Mills Creek, Sherod Creek, Old Woman`s Creek, West Branch Huron River, Edson Creek, Chappel Creek, Little Pickerel Creek, Sulphur Brook and Sugar Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
